SEARCH
Package bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.model

Class Patron

java.lang.Object
bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.model.Patron
public class Patron extends Object
The Patron class models a patron of a library. The class has 5 variables, 4 of which are required to construct an instance. They are as follows:

  • id: Integer (required) - The primary key for each instance of the class. Used to search for specific instances.

  • name: String (required) - The name of the patron.

  • phone: String (required) - The phone number of the patron.

  • email: String (required) - The email of the patron.

  • books: ArrayList of Books - An internal list to track the books the user has on loan.

    • Patron

      public Patron(Integer idValue, String nameValue, String phoneNumber, String emailValue)
      Create a new Patron instance. The constructor initialises a Patron object using the basic mandatory fields a patron should have to exist in the library.
      Parameters:
      idValue - - the patron's id.
      nameValue - - the patron's name.
      phoneNumber - - the patron's phone
      emailValue - - the patron's email

    • borrowBook

      public void borrowBook(Loan loan, Book book, LocalDate dueDate) throws LibraryException, InvalidDateException
      Borrow a book from the library. The method uses a newly created Loan object that associates a book with the patron and updates the book with this loan information. The function also adds the book to the patron's list of borrowed books. If the book is on loan by another patron, an exception is thrown with a message saying that the book is currently on loan.
      Parameters:
      loan - - the newly created loan object to associate with the book and patron.
      book - - the book that will be borrowed by the patron.
      dueDate - - the LocalDate value that will be set as the loan's due Date
      Throws:
      LibraryException - if the book is currently on loan to another patron.
      InvalidDateException - If the due date is before the start date.

    • renewBook

      public void renewBook(Book book, LocalDate dueDate) throws LibraryException, InvalidDateException
      Renew the loan's due date for a book that is already on loan. The method changes (renews) the due date of a book that is currently on loan by the patron. If the book to be renewed is not on loan by the patron, an exception is thrown with a message saying that the book is not on loan to this patron.
      Parameters:
      book - - the book to be renewed.
      dueDate - - the LocalDate value that will be set as the loan's new due date.
      Throws:
      LibraryException - If the book is not on loan to this patron.
      InvalidDateException - If the due date is set before or on the start date.

    • returnBook

      public void returnBook(Book book) throws LibraryException
      Return a book to the library. The method removes the book from the patron's list of borrowed books and returns the book to the library by removing any loan information from the book. If the book to be renewed is not on loan by the patron, an exception is thrown with a message saying that the book is not on loan to this patron.
      Parameters:
      book - - the book to be returned to the library.
      Throws:
      LibraryException - If the book is not on loan to this patron.

    • addBook

      public void addBook(Book book)
      Add a book to the patron's list of borrowed books. This method is used to add books that are on loan by the patron when loading data from the text file storage. The book given as argument to this method should already have the loan information added to it.
      Parameters:
      book - - the book to be added to the patron's list of borrowed books

    • parse

      public static Patron parse(String patronString)

      Turns a String into a Patron object, Used when loading Patron Objects 

       |                         String format                         |
 +------------+-------------+---------------------+--------------+
 |  Patron ID | Patron Name | Patron Phone Number | Patron email |
 +------------+-------------+---------------------+--------------+
 |     00     |  John Smith |        Author       |     1999     |
 +------------+-------------+---------------------+--------------+
      Parameters:
      patronString - - The string representation of a Patron object
      Returns:
      A new Patron object matching the string representation.
